Yii Framework v2.0.0-dev Class Reference

Class yii\debug\Module

All Classes | Properties | Methods
Inheritanceyii\debug\Module » yii\base\Module » yii\base\Component » yii\base\Object
Implementsyii\base\Arrayable
Available since version2.0
Source Code
The Yii Debug Module provides the debug toolbar and debugger

Property Details

$controllerNamespace property
string $controllerNamespace = 'yii\debug\controllers'

The namespace that controller classes are in.

$allowedIPs property
array $allowedIPs = ['127.0.0.1', '::1']

The list of IPs that are allowed to access this module. Each array element represents a single IP filter which can be either an IP address or an address with wildcard (e.g. 192.168.0.*) to represent a network segment. The default value is ['127.0.0.1', '::1'], which means the module can only be accessed by localhost.

$logTarget property
yii\debug\LogTarget $logTarget = null

$panels property
array|yii\debug\Panel[] $panels = []

$dataPath property
string $dataPath = '@runtime/debug'

The directory storing the debugger data files. This can be specified using a path alias.

$historySize property
integer $historySize = 50

The maximum number of debug data files to keep. If there are more files generated, the oldest ones will be removed.

$behaviors property read-only
yii\base\Behavior[] getBehaviors( )

list of behaviors attached to this component

$uniqueId property read-only
string getUniqueId( )

the unique ID of the module.

$basePath property
string getBasePath( )
void setBasePath( $path )

the root directory of the module.

$controllerPath property
string getControllerPath( )
void setControllerPath( $path )

the directory that contains the controller classes.

$viewPath property
string getViewPath( )
void setViewPath( $path )

the root directory of view files. Defaults to "$basePath/view".

$layoutPath property
string getLayoutPath( )
void setLayoutPath( $path )

the root directory of layout files. Defaults to "$viewPath/layouts".

$aliases property write-only
void setAliases( $aliases )

List of path aliases to be defined. The array keys are alias names (must start with '@') and the array values are the corresponding paths or aliases. For example,

[
'@models' => '@app/models', // an existing alias
'@backend' => __DIR__ . '/../backend',  // a directory
]

$modules property
array getModules( $loadedOnly = false )
void setModules( $modules )

the modules (indexed by their IDs)

void setComponents( $components )

the components (indexed by their IDs)
